source: # print statement
print("Hello world!")
print(f'Hello world!') #formating
# Variable

### Naming conventions:
* Start with alphabets preferbly.
* Name it so that it means something to that you assign. 
* Try Avoid using variables like 'x','y' beacause it doesnt mean anything and the code will look ugly

# variable priniting:
name='Kaggle'
old=21
# Multiple assignment variables
fname,lname="john","doe"
print(f'welcome {fname} {lname}!')
# Data types

# basic data types

text= 'kaggle'
numeric_int= int(9.123) # prints only 9. this is called casting
numeric_float= float(22.22)
bool(True)        # uppercase of True/False is a must : True,False,None

#sequence types:
grocery_list =["apple","cake","vegetables"]
grocery_tuples=("milk","essential items")  # cannot be modified
grocery_set={"redchilli","turmeric","sauce"}
number_list=range(4)

#dictinoary:
# name of dict ={key:value}
phone_book={"kaggle":22209,"colab":90882}
# Lists

# :::  list :::

# list can have duplicates.
speed=[1,2,1,1,3]
typeofcar=['mz','sant','mz','mz','bhu']  # remember, the values are strings.

# to get the first value from the list: the process of indexing and getting the value.
print(speed[0])

# to get all values from the list:
print(speed[0:]) 

# to get a specific section of the list:
print(typeofcar[2:4])

# to get the last value:
print(speed[-1])

#reverseing a list
print(typeofcar[::-1])

#mixed list
mixedlist=[1,1,'mz',2,'3','bhu',True]


# change item in list
mixedlist[0]="I am new to this list!"

# insert item in list
mixedlist.insert(1,"using insert, i am here!")

#add items in list
mixedlist.append("lastmember") # append always works at last

#extend list
list1=["apple","mango"]
list2=["onions","tomato"]


print(list1+list2)       #adding two lists
new_list=[*list1,*list2] # new to create a lists with two lists. 
print(new_list)

# remove item in list
vortex=["spiral","cyclone","circularair","storm"]
print(vortex.remove("cyclone")) # if index inside the remove parameter is not mentioned, by default it removes the last item

# clear the list items:
vortex.clear()

#sort list
ages_of_students=[22,19,20,21,21,23,18]
print(ages_of_students.sort())            #asecending
print(ages_of_students.sort(reverse=True)) #descending

#count items
print(len(ages_of_students)) #  gives the lenght of the list which is nothing but the count of items

# Tuples
* Tuples have definite order and it will not change
* Allows duplicates
* Tuples are unchangeable and we cannot change, add or remove items after the tuple has been created.
* Tuples are indexed, they can have items with the same value:

new_tuple=("red","blue","violet","green") # we cannot change the items 
# if we want to change values, we need to convert to list and work with that.
list_type_new_tuple=list(new_tuple)
list_type_new_tuple[0]="magneta"
new_tuple=tuple(list_type_new_tuple)
print(new_tuple)

#multiplying values
money=(10,50,100)*2 # the tuple creates a another tuple value (2) inside the same tuple
print(money)

# Sets
* Unorderd,no definite order
* referencing using index wont work
* Items cannot be changed
* Duplications are not allowed

new_set={"cars","furniture","monitors","speakers"}
# to acces items ,we can use for loop we will deal with for loops later. 
# to check wheather an item is in the list
print("cars" in new_set) 

# to add items in set
new_set.add("headsets")
new_set.update({"screen proctector","mouse"})
print(new_set)

# to remove set items
new_set.remove("mouse")
new_set.clear()

#union sets
A={"audi","bmw","benz"}
B={"audi","caterham","lexsus"}
A_U_B=A.union(B)
print(A_U_B)

#Intersection sets
A_intersection_B=A.intersection(B)
print(A_intersection_B)

# Symmetric difference
sym_diff_A_B=A.symmetric_difference(B)
print(sym_diff_A_B)

#isdisjoint
#issubset
#isuperset
# Dictinoary items
dictName= { key : value ,... }

robo={
    "name":'ASIMOV',
    "production":"AK LABS",
    "year":2020
}

print("to get the value for specific variable :",robo["name"])
# to list all the keys for the particular dictionary:
print(robo.keys()) 
print('\n') # this creates a new line
keys_from_robo=robo.keys() # you can also store it 

#to get values:
values_from_robo=robo.values()
print("The keys are :",keys_from_robo,"The values are :",values_from_robo)

#to modify values:
robo["name"]="megatron"
print("After modifying :",robo,"\n")

#to add items:
robo["alive status"]="its alive!"
print("After adding a extra variable :",robo)

#to remove items:
robo.pop("year")
print("After removing the year",robo)

#to remove clear dictinoary :
print("Cleared :",robo.clear()) # the dictionary is deleted

# nested dictionary:

details_of_area1={
        "person1":"kaggale",
        "lives":"LA"    
                 }

details_of_area2={
        "person2":"jhon doe",
        "lives":"CA"
                  }
city={
    "area1":details_of_area1,
    
    "area2":details_of_area2
    
    
}

print("Nested dictinoary",city)
# Strings

# add strings:
first_name='Tom'
last_name='Cruise'
actor=first_name+last_name

# change of types:
txt_number="333" # str type
print(int(txt_number)) # changes to int type. Easy for doing calculations. the str format is not capable of performing math

# to change to upper 
txt_city1="india"
print(txt_city1.upper())  
# to change to lower
txt_city2="BHUTAN"
print(txt_city2.lower())

# txt sclicing:
year_month="2020JUNE"
year=year_month[0:4]  # [0:4] means, 0 till 4 (4 th will not be inlcuded). 0,1,2,3.So, in string, it selects only 0 to 4 that is, only the year is selected 
print(f'The year is{int(year)}') # here the year is closed with int for casting. now its a integer type.
# Operators

print("addition and subtraction")
x=5+6
y=x-10
print("x :",x,"y :",y)

print("Multiplicatiion")
z=(-3)*y
print("z :",z)

print("Divion :")
v=10%2
u=10/2
w=10//2
print("modulus operator :",v)
print("Division :",u)
print("Floor division:",w)

print("pwoer of")
p=4**2
print("4 square is :",p)

print("adcanced method :")
x+=1 # similar to x=x+1

#Comparision operators
print(f"Comparision operators")
x==y #equaltiy
x!=y # not equal
x > y # greater than
x < y # less than
x<=y # less than equal to

# logical operatos
print(f'Identity operators')
x=7
print(x>5 and x<10)
print(x<5 or  x >5)
print(not( x>5 or x<10  ))

#identity operators
print("Identity operators")
age1=21
age2=22
print(age1 is age2)
print(age2 is not age1)
# For loop

# simple for loop

for i in range(0,5):
    print("The loop ran :",i)
# with step value:
print("\n")
for i in range(0,10,2):
    # step value =2. jumps 2 values . by default,the step value is 1.
    print("value in the loop",i)
print("\n")
# for lists :
v=[2,3,4,5]
for i in range(len(v)):
    print(v[i])
print("\n")
#breaking!
for i in range(0,10):
    print(" After 1, the loop is breaks out. Bacause it has the break statement with it. \n Can be embededd with if else or other conditons !")
    break
print("\n")
for i in v:
    print("values fetched:",i)
    
print("\n")

#list comprehension:
list_comp=[x for x in range(0,10)]
print(list_comp)
print("\n")
# multiple looping :
users=["don","brad","tom"]
snacks=["pizza","burger","vadai"]
for particular_user in users:
    print(f'The current user is :{particular_user}')
    for indexer in range(len(snacks)):  # its efficient to write : 'for particluar_snacks in snacks:'
        print(f'Now the the user {particular_user} eats :{snacks[indexer]}')
print("\n")

# if for loops has nothing to do with :
for i in range(0,5):
    pass # a for loop cant be empty . pass statements passes on the next iteration
# If Else

# basic if else
a=10
b=12

if a > b:
    print(" A is greater")
else:
    print("A is small")

# if else in list comprehension:
even_list=[ x for x in range(0,10) if x%2==0]
print(" The list comp :",even_list)

#else if
volume=200
capacity=3000
if volume < capacity:
    print( "test 1: basic weight added, passed")
    if volume+100 < capacity:
        print("test 2: added extra weight, also passed!")
    else:
        print(" dont add extra weight!")
else:
    print(" Not even holding standard weight! ")
    
if volume > capacity:
    print("passed!")
elif volume+2000:   # extra if condition
    print(" added 2000 and exceed the capacity !")
else:
    print("irregular capacity")
# While loop

#basic while loop
count=0
while count < 5:
    print(count,":>> okay pract is less than 5")
    count+=1
print("\n")
#while with if:
counter=0
while counter <10:
    print(" In loop value :",counter)
    if counter <=3:
        print("the loop broke at the value ",counter)
    else:
        print("Argh! the value is going up beyond our conditon! Break now!")
        break
    counter+=1
print("\n")

# with continue statement:
xi=0
while xi <10:
    xi+=1
    if xi%2!=0:
        print("odd value :",xi)
    else:
        print("even value, never mind!")
        continue
        # nothing wont be taken after this block
        print(" this wont show up!")
# Functions

def greet(name):
    msg="welcome "+name
    return msg
greet("Jerry") # this will have return value but nothing cant be done unless we assign or print it out
print(greet("Tomas"))
spike=greet("Spike") # Assigning the return value
print(spike)

def email(prefix,org):
    complete_email=" the complete email is : "+prefix+org
    return complete_email # without return stateement, it prodcues none.
myemailid_prefix='jackie.chan'
my_org='@cartoon.com'

jackiemail=email(myemailid_prefix,my_org)
print("Here is",jackiemail)

# math:
def circle_area(radius):
    area=22/7*radius**2
    return area   # also straight away : return 22/7*radius**2
my_newcircle=circle_area(4)
print(round(my_newcircle,3)) # round of takes ( number , no.of.digits to be rounded)
# Lambda function
Its a anonymous function, small and has only a single expression

squarefunc = lambda val : val**2
squared_value= squarefunc(5)
print(squared_value)

area_rectangle=lambda l,b: l*b
print(area_rectangle(10,90))
# Classes and objects

# basic class
class helloworld:
    msg="hello there!"
newmsg=helloworld() # create an object
print(newmsg.msg) # the value of msg for the object newmsg

#class using init

class robot:
    def __init__(self,name,company): # this is called a contructor
        self.name=name # instance 
        self.company=company
        self.about="The robo name is : "+self.name+" and created in the company "+self.company
        
    def speak(self):   # inheritence
        return "THE WORLD NEEDS YOU, "+self.name
        
robot1=robot("Barbara","Honda")
print(robot1.about)
print(robot1.speak())
# Math

min_vale = min(125, 12220, 25)
max_value = max(2325, 14233242350, 2353579065)
abs_value = abs(-733434.2232324235363634656456)
powerof= pow(4, 3) # 4*4*4

import math
x = math.sqrt(64)

x = math.ceil(1.4) # uper round
y = math.floor(1.4) # lower round
# Regx
https://www.w3schools.com/python/python_regex.asp

import re
a_msg="Here the world needs peace!"
reqs=re.search("\AHere",a_msg) # begining
print(reqs)
# Error handling

## Some common python errors:
1. SyntaxError
Raised when the syntax of the loop such as missing a ':", missing key words such as 'in', 'range'
2.IndentationError
Raised when 4 space is not provided properly for the blocks. 
3.TypeError
Raised when inncorrect operation of different type of variable. To check type of the variable, use (type (var_name))
4.IndexError
Raised when the index reaches beyond the specified limit. Offen occurs in loop range given more than the list range
5.ImportError
Raised when the file is not imported properly.Check the path or check wheather the module is installed properly
6.ValueError
Raises when the function argument is given wrongly.
7.NameError
Raises when the variable is not defined. Possibly due to spelling mistakes

If we know where the error is going to happen, we can use 'try except'
# Assertion
This comes handy when we specify a condtion to be true and evalue after that.Failing to meet the requirements results in AsssertionError

# Decorators
Adding additional responsibilites whithout modifying the function.
Here the something function is added with a extra fucntion '@something' and writing a another new function without modifying
